collaborativeProjects.title: Digital Bone Box
description: An interactive, mobile-friendly web app for anatomy students to study the human skeleton.

I am currently working as a tech lead for this project, leading a team of two undergraduate developers as part of a simulated Agile app development environment for the undergraduate senior capstone project for SLU's computer science program. We are working on adding more sets of bones into the app and improving the interface of the study tools.

collaborativeProjects.title: Pi4Micronaut
description: Java library with Micronaut framework to facilitate IoT interaction with Raspberry Pis.

In the fall semester of 2025, I was a tech lead for this project. Under my leadership, we added support for more hardware components, improved documentation to encourage and facilitate more public open-source contributions, and streamlined our deployment strategy. I previously was an undergraduate developer on the project, where I helped add support for numerous GPIO hardware components, wrote unit tests, wrote documentation, and performed hardware testing.

collaborativeProjects.title: AI I Spy
description: An AI-powered version of the game I Spy, created by integrating two different publicly available AI models. I built this as part of a set of AI-based tools created with a classmate to entertain children, as the final project for the AI in Modern Software Development class at SLU.

collaborativeProjects.title: TPEN Services
description: Node.js back end for TPEN project helping organize data for humanities researchers.
I contributed as part of simulated Agile app development environment for senior capstone project. Contributions added include added API endpoints and comprehensive unit testing.

collaborativeProjects.title: Gallery of Glosses
description: Front end Next.js TypeScript web app for presenting research data to theological scholars. During the summer of 2024, I added several new filters and pages for viewing data.

collaborativeProjects.title: Java Chess
description: Chess game created as the final project for CSCI 2300: Principles of Object-Oriented Software Design. Made collaboratively with two other students as a showcase of MVC design architecture and the Java Swing GUI library.

individualProjects.title: Flow for Spotify
description: A tool to reorder a diverse playlist for the smoothest transition between each genre and style. Find your playlist's perfect flow.

individualProjects.title: Music Blog
description: Music blog as the final project for CSCI 4360: Web Technologies, as a showcase of JavaScript and CSS frameworks.

individualProjects.title: Twenty Questions
description: A version of the game Twenty Questions, remade from a version that I created when I first was learning Python.
